sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"感觉"之意。
means: feeling ： 最普通用词，既可指身体上的感觉，如冷暖、饥饿、疼痛等，又可指精神上的感觉，如喜、怒、哀、乐、失望等。
sensation系较严密的科学用词，指听觉、味觉、视觉、嗅觉或触觉；还可指引起激动或轰动的事物。
sense ： 主要指人或动物身体上的感觉。复数形式指人的知觉。
perception ： 侧重对外界刺激的反应和对产生感觉的物体的辨别。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"识别力，判断"之意。
means: judgement ： 指经过训练或磨练或凭经历而得到辨别或判断事物的能力或品质。
discrimination ： 指辨别精微的能力，甚至平时观察不到的也可识别出来。
sense ： 指不带幻想或感情、偏见地观察事物，并能作出明智、公平的选择与决定。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"含义，意义，意思"之意。
means: meaning ： 普通用词，使用广泛。既可指语言表达的意思，又可指手势、符号、表情或艺术品或抽象概念所含的意义。
implication ： 指暗含的意思。
sense ： 特指词、短语或句子的某种特定意思。也常指多种解释的一种。

entry.def: Your senses are the physical abilities of sight, smell, hearing, touch, and taste.
entry.tran: 感觉官能(即视觉、嗅觉、听觉、触觉、味觉)

example.ex: She stared at him again, unable to believe the evidence of her senses.
example.tran: 她再度盯着他看，无法相信自己的眼睛和耳朵。

example.ex: ...a keen sense of smell.
example.tran: 灵敏的嗅觉

entry.def: If you sense something, you become aware of it or you realize it, although it is not very obvious.

example.ex: She probably sensed that I wasn't telling her the whole story...
example.tran: 她可能意识到了我并没有对她全盘托出。

example.ex: He looks about him, sensing danger...
example.tran: 他四下看了看，感觉到有危险。

entry.def: If you have a sense that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you may not have firm, clear evidence for this belief.

example.ex: Suddenly you got this sense that people were drawing themselves away from each other...
example.tran: 突然间你就有这样一种感觉：人们正在彼此疏远。

example.ex: There is no sense of urgency on either side.
example.tran: 两边都没有紧迫感。

entry.def: If you have a sense of guilt or relief, for example, you feel guilty or relieved.

example.ex: When your child is struggling for life, you feel this overwhelming sense of guilt...
example.tran: 当你的孩子在挣扎求生时，你会感到非常内疚。

example.ex: Lulled into a false sense of security, we eagerly awaited their return.
example.tran: 我们被一种虚假的安全感所麻痹，急切地等着他们回来。

entry.def: If you have a sense of something such as duty or justice, you are aware of it and believe it is important.

example.ex: My sense of justice was offended...
example.tran: 我的正义感被激了起来。

example.ex: We must keep a sense of proportion about all this...
example.tran: 我们对所有的这些都要有轻重缓急之分。

entry.def: Someone who has a sense of timing or style has a natural ability with regard to timing or style. You can also say that someone has a bad sense of timing or style.

example.ex: He has an impeccable sense of timing...
example.tran: 他有着无可挑剔的节奏感。

example.ex: Her dress sense is appalling.
example.tran: 她穿衣打扮的品位实在糟透了。

entry.def: Sense is the ability to make good judgments and to behave sensibly.
entry.tran: 理智;头脑;良好的判断力

example.ex: ...when he was younger and had a bit more sense...
example.tran: 在他年纪更轻一些而且还有点头脑的时候

example.ex: When that doesn't work they sometimes have the sense to seek help...
example.tran: 那种方法不奏效的时候，他们有时会想到要寻求帮助。

entry.def: If you say that there is no sense or little sense in doing something, you mean that it is not a sensible thing to do because nothing useful would be gained by doing it.

example.ex: There's no sense in pretending this doesn't happen...
example.tran: 假装这件事没有发生毫无意义。

example.ex: There's little sense in trying to outspend a competitor with a much larger service factory.
example.tran: 试图比竞争对手花更多的钱建一个大得多的维修厂没有什么意义。

entry.def: A sense of a word or expression is one of its possible meanings.

example.ex: ...a noun which has two senses...
example.tran: 有两个意思的名词

example.ex: Then she remembered that they had no mind in any real sense of that word.
example.tran: 然后她想起来他们对那个词的真正意思一无所知。

entry.def: Sense is used in several expressions to indicate how true your statement is. For example, if you say that something is true in a sense, you mean that it is partly true, or true in one way. If you say that something is true in a general sense, you mean that it is true in a general way.
entry.tran: 从某种意义上说/总的来说。

example.ex: In a sense, both were right...
example.tran: 从某种意义上来说，两者都对。

example.ex: In one sense, the fact that few new commercial buildings can be financed does not matter...
example.tran: 从某种意义上说，只有少数新建商业大厦可以融到资金的情况其实并不重要。

entry.def: If something makes sense, you can understand it.

example.ex: He was sitting there saying, 'Yes, the figures make sense.'
example.tran: 他坐在那儿说：“是的，这些数字可以理解。”

example.ex: It all makes sense now.
example.tran: 现在就都讲得通了。

entry.def: When you make sense of something, you succeed in understanding it.

example.ex: Provided you didn't try to make sense of it, it sounded beautiful...
example.tran: 只要不非得弄懂它的意思，它听上去还是很美的。

example.ex: This is to help her to come to terms with her early upbringing and make sense of past experiences.
example.tran: 这旨在帮助她认可自己早先所受的教育，并让她了解自己过去的经历。

entry.def: If a course of action makes sense, it seems sensible.

example.ex: It makes sense to look after yourself...
example.tran: 自己应该照顾自己。

example.ex: The project should be reappraised to see whether it made sound economic sense...
example.tran: 该项目应重新评估，以确定其是否可以产生良好的经济效益。

entry.def: If you say that someone has come to their senses or has been brought to their senses, you mean that they have stopped being foolish and are being sensible again.
entry.tran: 恢复理性;清醒过来;醒悟过来

example.ex: Eventually the world will come to its senses and get rid of them...
example.tran: 最终这世界会清醒过来，将它们全部丢弃。

example.ex: May her death bring these people to their senses.
example.tran: 但愿她的死能让这些人醒悟。

entry.def: If you say that someone seems to have taken leave of their senses, you mean that they have done or said something very foolish.
entry.tran: 发疯;失去理智;精神失常

example.ex: They looked at me as if I had taken leave of my senses.
example.tran: 他们看着我，就像我已经疯了一样。

entry.def: If you say that someone talks sense, you mean that what they say is sensible.
If you have a sense that something is true or get a sense that something is true, you think that it is true.

example.ex: Do you have the sense that you are loved by the public?
example.tran: 你认为自己深受民众喜爱吗？

example.ex: I get a sense that people are feeling better about themselves.
example.tran: 我觉得现在人们的自我感觉更好了。

sentences.sentence: "a sense of security"
"a sense of happiness"
"a sense of danger"
"a sense of self"

means.word_mean: 2. the meaning of a word or expression; the way in which a word or expression or situation can be interpreted;

sentences.sentence: "the dictionary gave several senses for the word"
"in the best sense charity is really a duty"
"the signifier is linked to the signified"

means.word_mean: 3. the faculty through which the external world is apprehended;

sentences.sentence: "in the dark he had to depend on touch and on his senses of smell and hearing"
"I can't see the sense in doing it now"
"he hasn't got the sense God gave little green apples"
"fortunately she had the good sense to run away"
"a keen musical sense"
"a good sense of timing"

means.word_mean: 1. perceive by a physical sensation, e.g., coming from the skin or muscles;

sentences.sentence: "He felt the wind"
"She felt an object brushing her arm"
"He felt his flesh crawl"
"She felt the heat when she got out of the car"

means.word_mean: 2. detect some circumstance or entity automatically;

sentences.sentence: "This robot can sense the presence of people in the room"
"particle detectors sense ionization"

means.word_mean: 3. become aware of not through the senses but instinctively;

sentences.sentence: "I sense his hostility"
"I sensed the real meaning of his letter"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun in the sense 'meaning'): from Latin sensus 'faculty of feeling, thought, meaning', from sentire 'feel'. The verb dates from the mid 16th cent

means: 感觉官能（即视、听、嗅、味、触五觉）
感觉
天赋，悟性
理智，判断力
好处
意义
看待…的角度
感觉到
意识到
检测出
